vulkan10core.name: robustBufferAccess
comment: widely supported but has performance overhead, so remains an optional feature to enable
Roadmap 2022 requires support for these, device support is ubiquitous and enablement is unlikely to harm performance
I have no clue if these cause overheads from simply being enabled

vulkan10core.name: logicOp
comment: [EXPOSE AS A LIMIT] somewhat legacy features
Roadmap 2022 requires support for these, device support is ubiquitous and enablement is unlikely to harm performance

vulkan10core.name: depthBounds
comment: this is kinda like a weird clip-plane that doesn't count towards clip plane count

entries.name: wideLines
comment: good device support, but a somewhat useless feature (constant screenspace width with limits on width)

entries.name: largePoints
comment: good device support, but a somewhat useless feature (axis aligned screenspace boxes with limits on size)

vulkan10core.name: samplerAnisotropy
comment: Roadmap 2022 requires support for these, device support is ubiquitous
[DO NOT EXPOSE] these 3 don't make a difference, just shortcut from Querying support from PhysicalDevice
[EXPOSE AS LIMIT] Enabled by Default, Moved to Limits

entries.name: shaderTessellationAndGeometryPointSize
comment: Candidate for promotion, just need to look into Linux and Android

vulkan10core.name: shaderStorageImageMultisample
comment: [EXPOSE AS LIMIT] Cannot be always enabled cause Intel ARC is handicapped
Apple GPUs and some Intels don't support

vulkan10core.name: shaderStorageImageReadWithoutFormat
comment: TODO: format feature reporting unimplemented yet for both of the below! (should we move to usage reporting?)
[EXPOSE AS LIMIT] always enable, shouldn't cause overhead by just being enabled

vulkan10core.name: shaderStorageImageArrayDynamicIndexing
comment: [EXPOSE AS A LIMIT] ROADMAP 2022 but Apple GPUs have poor support
ROADMAP 2022 but no iOS GPU supports

vulkan10core.name: shaderFloat64
comment: [EXPOSE AS A LIMIT] Cannot be always enabled cause Intel ARC is handicapped
Intel Gen12 and ARC are special-boy drivers (TM)
[TODO LATER] once we implemented sparse resources

vulkan10core.name: variableMultisampleRate
comment: [EXPOSE AS LIMIT] poor support on Apple GPUs
[EXPOSE AS A LIMIT] Enabled by Default, Moved to Limits : ALIAS VK_KHR_16bit_storage

vulkan11core.name: multiview
comment: Required to be present when Vulkan 1.1 is supported
[EXPOSE AS A LIMIT] VK_KHR_multiview required but these depend on pipelines and MoltenVK mismatches these
Core 1.1 Features or VK_KHR_multiview, normally would be required but MoltenVK mismatches these
Will eventually be required by HLSL202x if it implements references or pointers (even the non-generic type)

vulkan11core.name: protectedMemory
comment: [DO NOT EXPOSE] not gonna expose until we have a need to
or via VkPhysicalDeviceProtectedMemoryProperties provided by Vulkan 1.1

vulkan11core.name: samplerYcbcrConversion
comment: [DO NOT EXPOSE] ROADMAP 2022 Enables certain formats in Vulkan
we just enable them if available or else we need to make format support query functions in LogicalDevice as well

vulkan12core.name: drawIndirectCount
comment: [EXPOSE AS A LIMIT] ROADMAP 2022 requires support but MoltenVK doesn't support

entries.name: storagePushConstant8
comment: [EXPOSE AS LIMIT] not great support yet

entries.name: shaderFloat16
comment: [EXPOSE AS LIMIT] ROADMAP 2024 but not great support yet

entries.name: shaderInputAttachmentArrayDynamicIndexing
comment: [EXPOSE AS A LIMIT] This is for a SPIR-V capability, the overhead should only be incurred if the pipeline uses this capability

entries.name: shaderUniformBufferArrayNonUniformIndexing
comment: [EXPOSE AS A LIMIT] ROADMAP 2022 mandates but poor device support

entries.name: shaderInputAttachmentArrayNonUniformIndexing
comment: [EXPOSE AS A LIMIT] This is for a SPIR-V capability, the overhead should only be incurred if the pipeline uses this capability

entries.name: descriptorBindingUniformBufferUpdateAfterBind
comment: We have special bits on the Descriptor Layout Bindings and those should decide the overhead, not the enablement of a feature like the following
[EXPOSE AS A LIMIT] not great coverage but still can enable when available

vulkan12core.name: samplerFilterMinmax
comment: TODO: Actually implement the sampler flag enums

vulkan12core.name: scalarBlockLayout
comment: Roadmap 2022 requires support for these we always enable and they're unlikely to harm performance

vulkan12core.name: imagelessFramebuffer
comment: [DO NOT EXPOSE] Decided against exposing, API is braindead, for details see: https://github.com/Devsh-Graphics-Programming/Nabla/issues/378

entries.name: bufferDeviceAddressCaptureReplay
comment: [DO NOT EXPOSE] for capture tools not engines

vulkan12core.name: vulkanMemoryModelAvailabilityVisibilityChains
comment: [EXPOSE AS A LIMIT] ROADMAP2022 wants them, but device support low
Vulkan 1.3 requires but we make concessions for MoltenVK

vulkan13core.name: robustImageAccess
comment: This feature adds stricter requirements for how out of bounds reads from images are handled.
most out of bounds reads return R, G, and B values of zero and alpha values of either zero or one.
Components not present in the image format may be set to zero
or to values based on the format as described in Conversion to RGBA in vulkan specification.
widely supported but has performance overhead, so remains an optional feature to enable
[DO NOT EXPOSE] VK_EXT_inline_uniform_block EVIL regressive step back into OpenGL/Dx10 times? Or an intermediate step between PC and UBO?
